intro: Calyptrocalyx albertisianus, commonly known as the Albertisian corymbifer, is a rare and unique plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive calypters—modified leaves that cover the flower buds, providing protection until they open. Its flowers are small, white or pink, and are arranged in corymbs, giving it a fluffy appearance. Calyptrocalyx albertisianus is of interest to botanists due to its unusual morphology and limited distribution.
